summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, demanding production of documents related to the civil litigation 'Jane Doe 43 v. Epstein, et al.' The subpoena is part of a federal criminal investigation into suspected violations of sex trafficking and related statutes, and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the investigation's confidentiality.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signs the subpoena cover letter and the subpoena itself as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the demand for records.

persons.name: Jane Doe 43
persons.context: Identified as the plaintiff in the civil litigation 'Jane Doe 43 v. Epstein, et al.,' which is the subject of the document subpoena.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Named as a defendant (likely Jeffrey Epstein) in the civil litigation 'Jane Doe 43 v. Epstein, et al.,' which is the target of the grand jury's document request.

connections.description: Implied by the civil lawsuit 'Jane Doe 43 v. Epstein, et al.,' which is the subject of the grand jury's investigative subpoena.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is authorizing a grand jury subpoena for documents related to a civil case involving Epstein, indicating a federal criminal investigation into Epstein.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which Boies Schiller Flexner LLP is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested documents.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena was issued and signed by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
575 Lexington Avenue, New York, NY 10022 (Boies Schiller Flexner LLP)
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a grand jury subpoena to the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP on February 5, 2019, as part of a federal criminal investigation into suspected violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), and 2422(b) (coercing travel for illegal sexual activity).

The subpoena specifically demands all non-privileged documents related to the civil case 'Jane Doe 43 v. Epstein, et al.,' 17 Civ. 0616, indicating the criminal investigation is directly tied to that litigation.
The government explicitly requested the law firm not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.
The subpoena rider details a broad request for litigation materials including discovery, depositions, court filings, evidence, and settlement agreements from the Jane Doe 43 case.
The document confirms an active federal grand jury investigation into Epstein was underway in the Southern District of New York in early 2019, prior to his arrest in July 2019.
